background.orientation: Division by zero is undefined and throws exceptions in most programming languages.
background.purpose: Test the behavior of division by zero in polynomial multiplication operations.
background.hypothesis: Division by zero will raise a ZeroDivisionError exception and prevent the completion of polynomial multiplication.

test_file_parameters.test_title: The Effects of Division by Zero on Polynomial Multiplication

independent_variable.name: Divisor Value
independent_variable.description: The value used as a divisor in the polynomial operation

dependent_variable.name: Calculation Result
dependent_variable.description: Whether the calculation completes successfully or raises an exception

validation_methods.description: Check if the expected exception is raised
validation_methods.name: exception
steps: Attempt to divide the first polynomial by zero
Multiply the result with the second polynomial
Verify that a ZeroDivisionError is raised

control_variables.name: Polynomial Degree
control_variables.description: The degree of the polynomials being multiplied

control_variables.name: Coefficient Range
control_variables.description: The range of values for polynomial coefficients

steps: Create two random polynomials with degree 2
